title: NASA's New Helper for Finding Alien Worlds
summary: NASA has launched a new mission called Pandora to help the James Webb Space Telescope find planets like Earth. The Webb telescope is a big space telescope that looks at faraway stars and planets to see if they might have life. It can detect chemicals like water vapor in planet atmospheres. But stars are very bright and have spots and flares that can make it hard to see the planets clearly. Pandora is a small, cheaper satellite that will watch the stars at the same time as Webb. This helps scientists tell if the chemicals they see are from the planet or the star. Pandora launched on a SpaceX rocket and will work from space to make Webb's discoveries more accurate. This mission helps us learn about other worlds and if they could support life.

background_read: Space telescopes like Webb help scientists learn about the universe. They look at stars and planets far away. Finding planets with water or other chemicals might mean they could support life, like Earth does. NASA sends missions to space to explore and answer big questions about other worlds.
Article_Structure: WHO: NASA and scientists like Daniel Apai and Tom Barclay
WHAT: Launching the Pandora mission to help the Webb telescope study exoplanets
WHERE: From Vandenberg Space Force Base in California into space
WHY: To make sure Webb's data about planet atmospheres is accurate by accounting for star brightness
